intro: Austroeupatorium decemflorum, commonly known as the ten-flowered aster, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It features showy purple to pink ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Austroeupatorium decemflorum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
